instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2251: What is A2251? A2251 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3348, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01949..
definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with water damage
pictures of water damage attached
motherboard <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07
goal: get user data
Please advise.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
Very uggly board; possibly waste of time.

You can try to clean with a fiber glass pen first.
Then need to check all traces and affected components.
You can also expect accumulated crap underneath BGA chips.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: We decided to change CD3217B12 chips as 2 of them was looping. We soldered 2 new chips and now all ports showing 5v 0.03amps. How I can check if these chips are working? or how to proceed further to investigate the cause/ other areas with damages? Thank you.
